meanings.definition: To such an extent or degree
meanings.sent1: She loved ice cream insomuch that she ate it every day.
meanings.sent2: He ran insomuch that he became the fastest in his class.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased the laser pointer insomuch that it forgot about its toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft was insomuch that he worked through the night.
meanings.sent5: The tree grew insomuch that it towered over the entire garden.

meanings.sent1: She decided to stay home insomuch she was feeling unwell.
meanings.sent2: He didn't go to the party insomuch he had to study for his exam.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked insomuch it saw a squirrel outside the window.
meanings.sent4: The team won the game insomuch they practiced hard every day.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed beautifully insomuch they were well taken care of.
